articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched an overnight drone attack on Ukraine's Kharkiv and Dnipro regions, injuring at least six people and hitting critical infrastructure, commercial and residential buildings, regional officials said on Saturday.
articles.title: Russian drones injure 6 in Ukraine's Kharkiv, Dnipro regions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australian police said on Sunday they shot dead a boy after he stabbed a man in Western Australia's capital Perth, in an attack authorities said indicated terrorism.
articles.title: Australian police shoot dead boy after stabbing with 'hallmarks' of terrorism

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin and scores of other Moscow worshippers attended an Easter service on Sunday, led by the head of Russia's Orthodox Church, Patriarch Kirill, a staunch supporter of the Russian leader and his war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Putin attends Easter service led by head of Russia's Orthodox Church

articles.author: Valentine Hilaire, Elida Moreno
articles.description: Panamanians will head to the polls in Sunday's general election to elect one of eight contenders to be the nation's next president and vote for hundreds of local lawmakers and officials.
articles.title: Panamanians vote in crowded field of presidential contenders

articles.author: Ali Sawafta
articles.description: Israeli forces killed five Palestinians, including four fighters from the militant group Hamas, in an overnight raid near the city of Tulkarm in the occupied West Bank, Palestinian and Israeli officials said on Saturday.
articles.title: Israeli forces kill Hamas gunmen in overnight raid near West Bank's Tulkarm

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands of Israelis protested on Saturday, demanding Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu accept a ceasefire agreement with the Islamist movement Hamas that would see the remaining Israeli hostages brought home from Gaza.
articles.title: Thousands of Israelis protest to demand hostage return

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ahmed Mohamed Hassan
articles.description: Hamas negotiators arrived in Cairo on Saturday for intensified talks on a possible Gaza truce that would see the return to Israel of some hostages, a Hamas official told Reuters, with the CIA director already present for the indirect diplomacy.
articles.title: Hamas negotiators arrive in Cairo for Gaza truce talks; CIA chief also present

articles.author: Jatindra Dash
articles.description: India will wait for Canadian police to share information on the three Indian men it has arrested and charged with the murder of a Sikh separatist leader last year, Foreign Minister Subrahmanyam Jaishankar said on Saturday.
articles.title: India waits for details on arrests in Canada over Sikh separatist's murder

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The "hostile line" of the Baltic countries have led to the severance of most of their ties with Russia, the Russian foreign ministry said in remarks published on Sunday, warning also that Moscow will respond with asymmetric measures.
articles.title: Russia blames Baltic countries for the severing of most ties

articles.author: Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: The three dead bodies found in Mexico's Baja California state are highly likely to be the American and two Australian tourists who went missing last week, a senior official from the region said on Saturday.
articles.title: Dead bodies in Mexico most probably are missing U.S., Australian surfers
